Principal - ITSM / Project Managment/PMP/PRINCE2 and Agile/Scrum Consultant, Coach, and Instructor

Principal - Project / Program Management/PMP/PRINCE2, Agile/Scrum, and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL)/IT Service Management (ITSM)  Beyond20 provides customers with the following services:• Program Management / Project Management / PMO / PRINCE2 consulting and assessments* ITSM / ITIL training, consulting, and assessments* Comptia CTT+, Security+, and Project+ certifications• Process improvement and system re-engineering / design• Enterprise ITSM and Project Management (EPM) system design, deployment, and training - including Microsoft Project, Portal Server, Project Server, and SharePoint 2003 / 2007 / 2010 as well as Cherwell Service Management (CSM / ITIL)• Onsite, classroom, and web-based training courses - ITIL, PMP, CAPM, PgMP, PRINCE2, Agile / Scrum Product Owner and ScrumMaster (CSM and CSPO), Devops, Agile, Scrum, and Scaled Agile (SAFe) training and coaching, Project Management Fundamentals, Polestar ITSM, Polestar Project Management, COBIT, and ISO 20k* Cherwell Service Management (CSM) consulting and implementationsBeyond20's Launchpad ITSM Assessment is the 2013 ABA People's Choice Award Winner for "Best B2B Service".  Author of, "Demystifying Agile, Scrum, and IT Service Management": http://goo.gl/1QEmTQBEYOND20 is proud to be a DBE certified woman-owned, minority-owned GSA 8(a) small business.

Manage the Process Capture team as part of the Records Retention committee for PMI's Washington DC chapter.  Responsibilities include: working with chapter board members to formally document processes, procedures, and policies; coordinating with / leading Process Capture volunteers; and managing process documentation on PMIWDC's SharePoint site.

itSMF is the definitive and authoritative source for the advancement of IT Service Management (ITSM) and ITIL.  itSMF is an independent, membership-oriented association dedicated to the advancement of IT Service Management / ITIL best practices through knowledge sharing, education, and networking.  Responsibilities included: overseeing strategic planning efforts, facilitating chapter meetings, managing volunteer efforts, etc.
San Diego State University (SDSU) - College of Extended Studies

Designed curriculum and served as instructor for San Diego State University's College of Extended Studies course "Microsoft Project Fundamentals".  This introductory course taught students how to create schedules in Microsoft Project using “dynamic scheduling” and PMI's Project Management (PMBOK / PMP) methodology - designing schedules correctly during project planning that are easily and automatically updated, creating less work later on during project execution.  The course covered both basic and advanced functionality of the tool, including Enterprise Project Management (EPM) concepts (Project Server, SharePoint, etc.).  Students completed weekly homework assignments and created multiple, detailed schedules to ensure comprehension and retention of course concepts.

ITSM / ITIL Process Improvement* Worked within the Program Management Office and led the progression of 21 IT and Project Management processes through the development lifecycle: Design, Implementation, and Adoption.  Created and managed the master program plan and schedule through program phases.* Reviewed existing ITSM processes and associated documentation.  Performed a gap analysis and provided recommendations to the Information Management (IM) division on process improvement initiatives.* Facilitated the collection of requirements and activities of the program team.  Collaborated with each of the ITSM Process Owners/Managers and held regular team meetings to resolve any issues related to process implementation.* Provided daily management and oversight of program tasks and coordinated the activities of the project team and other stakeholders.* Created ITSM process documentation including Process Design Specifications, policies, procedures, metrics, and user training surveys.ITSM Tool Implementation* Served as a Subject Matter Expert and team member for Phase 1 roll-out of the VMWare Infra (previously EMC's Ionix) Service Management application to ensure proper integration with ITIL based standards and existing processes in development.  Phase 1 included implementation of Incident and Problem Management.  * Led Phase 2 of the Infra application initiative, which included Change Management and Service Request workflows.  Performed requirements planning for Phase 3, Knowledge Management.  * Managed all aspects of the project: Planning, Design, Development, Testing, Training, and Implementation.  Wrote test scripts for system super users and training curriculum for IT staff.

Lead and direct Project Management Institute (PMI) San Diego volunteers in the following areas:* Corporate Outreach* Community Outreach* Academic Outreach* Public Relations* MarketingBuild alliances and relationships with professional organizations, PMI chapters, corporate partners, sponsors and advertisers, academic institutions, etc.

IT Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence* Worked with the Process Engineering team, Internal Business Operations, and DW&BI customers to define business requirements.  Developed project scope/plan to provide improvement solutions.* Used Process Improvement and Project Management methodology to analyze, define, and re-engineer existing processes.* Developed documentation to successfully plan and execute new process improvement initiatives.  This included process flowcharts, work instructions, policies, procedures, forms, templates, surveys, and training curriculum.* Created and maintained schedules in Microsoft Project 2003/2007 to manage improvement programs and projects.  * Led project teams in the following areas: Solution Development Lifecycle (SDLC), finance, and ITIL-based metrics.* Managed documentation and website content on Microsoft Office SharePoint (MOSS) 2007 and provided expertise in consolidating and migrating information. * Provided project status updates and reports.  Communicated with and manage expectations of stakeholders both within and external to the DW&BI group.* Rolled-out process improvement projects and trained users within and external to the DW&BI group.  * Performed audits and assessments to determine levels of compliance with new processes; provided recommendations to the Leadership Team; and developed future continuous improvement programs and projects.

Managed 50+ volunteers within Corporate Outreach, Community Outreach, Academic Outreach, Marketing and Public Relations,  Implemented more than 30 new programs.  Voted “Volunteer of the Year” by PMI International in 2007, out of more than 250,000 members worldwide, for increasing volunteer base from 2 to 200 in one year.  Received PMI International’s award for “Excellence in Outreach and Collaboration”, 2008.

*Planned, led, and implemented an EPM system that included MS Project 2007, Project Web Access 2007, and Microsoft Office SharePoint Services (MOSS) 2007 at multiple facilities. *Organized and created online access of Program Management documents within WSS.*Created in-class and online training curriculum for Program Planning, Risk Management, Microsoft Project 2003/2007, Project Web Access 2007, and SharePoint / MOSS 2007.*Produced custom training manuals for all system users*Performed a comprehensive needs assessment of all Program Management practices at numerous facilities.  Designed and implemented a multi-faceted improvement plan. *Redesigned the Program Management documentation system; Wrote SOPs, process flowcharts, and work instructions for various stages of the project life cycle.  *Implemented Meeting Guidelines, Program Status Reports, Project Metrics, etc.*Created templates and repeatable processes for project teams.*Drafted Lessons Learned documentation and facilitated meetings to promote knowledge sharing.

*Served as the lead in deploying a company-wide, web-based Enterprise Project Management (EPM) system including Microsoft Project, Project Server, and SharePoint.*Worked with the QA, RA, and Nonclinical departments to translate needs into PM and technology initiatives.*Created an online Change Request system.*Developed schedules for research, clinical, and CMC departments.  *Designed master schedules in accordance with NDA in eCTD format.*Organized and maintained a cost accounting system to track internal and external costs by project and program.  *Measured project progress against baselined plans.  Administered a stoplight system for quick reference of project status.*Wrote and distributed monthly reports to executive staff and project managers.    *Organized and archived nonclinical study information.  Maintained the Master Research Schedule for studies performed by the Research department in accordance with GLPs.*Reviewed and edited nonclinical protocols and reports.*Redesigned the Project Management SOP system and related documentation.

summary: Erika is a scientist by training and has experience in the pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device fields with expertise is in process improvement, technology implementation, and training/mentoring. She is PMP, PgMP, PRINCE2 Practitioner, ITIL Expert, Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), and Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) through the Scrum Alliance, CAPM, & Certified Cherwell Service Management (CSM) ITSM implementer as well as Microsoft Project / Project Server Black Belt certified. She is a skilled writer and presenter. Erika is active in the community as a volunteer and has served on the boards of numerous non-profit organizations. She is passionate about making a difference and was awarded the “2007 Volunteer of the Year” by PMI International. She is the author of "Demystifying Agile, Scrum, and IT Service Management" and "(More Than) 101 Ways to Add Value to Your PMI Chapter - A Guidebook for Volunteer Leaders". Areas of expertise include:* Project / Program Management / PMO consulting and assessments* CAPM, PMP, PgMP, and PRINCE2 certification training* Polestar Project Management and ITSM simulation workshops* Microsoft EPM training and consulting (Project, Project Server, and SharePoint)* ITIL / ITSM, COBIT, and ISO 20k assessment, training, and consulting* Scrum, Agile, and SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) training and coaching* Cherwell Service Management (ITIL / ITSM) consulting and implementation* Comptia CTT+, Security+, DevOpsSec, and Project+Specialties: Project & Program Management, Program Management Office (PMO), Microsoft Enterprise Project Management (EPM), Microsoft Project, SharePoint, Project Server, PMP certification instructor, PgMP, IT, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), COBIT, ISO 20k, IT Service Management (ITSM), Cherwell, Certified ScrumMaster and Product Owner (CSM and CSPO), Agile/Scrum Coach, SAFe, Devops, PRINCE2 Practitioner, biotech, healthcare, pharmaceutical
